title: Comparing Machines and Children: Using Developmental Psychology Experiments to Assess the Strengths and Weaknesses of LaMDA Responses. (arXiv:2305.11243v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Developmental psychologists have spent decades devising experiments to test the intelligence and knowledge of infants and children, tracing the origin of crucial concepts and capacities. Moreover, experimental techniques in developmental psychology have been carefully designed to discriminate the cognitive capacities that underlie particular behaviors. We propose that using classical experiments from child development is a particularly effective way to probe the computational abilities of AI models, in general, and LLMs in particular. translated_title: 比较机器和儿童：使用发展心理学实验评估LaMDA响应的优势和劣势
translated_abstract: 发展心理学家花费了几十年的时间设计实验来测试婴儿和儿童的智力和知识，追溯重要概念和能力的起源。我们认为，使用儿童发展的经典实验是探究人工智能模型的计算能力，尤其是LLM模型的最有效的方式之一。其次，将LLM与儿童进行比较可以帮助我们开发更具有人类特点和可解释性的机器学习模型，使它们能够嵌入到需要与人交互的实际环境中。
tldr: 使用儿童发展实验来评估人工智能的计算能力，同时比较LLMs和儿童可以帮助我们开发更具人类特征和可解释性的机器学习模型。
en_tdlr: Using classic experiments from child development is an effective way to assess the computational abilities of AI models, particularly LLMs, and comparing them with children can help develop more human-like and interpretable machine learning models.
